content: popcorn granny square april 2019 lynn johnson the bronze knot a simple but versatile afghan block which starts as a traditional granny square before wandering off to something a little more fanciful it is relatively straightforward and works up quickly skill level adventurous beginner crochet terms - us / measurement - metric yarn & hook size & gauge gauge is not important for this pattern and it will work in any weight of yarn use an appropriate hook aiming to achieve a fabric which is stiff enough to hold the definition of the popcorns but loose enough to still have some drape the sample above was made in drops lima which is a dk weight wool/alpaca mix 100m per 50g ball the recommended hook size for this yarn is 4 00mm i used a 5 00mm hook going up 0 5mm because lima is a particularly substantial dk yarn and a further 0 5mm because i work snug to the hook it still felt quite stiff whilst working but as expected it eased up considerably once washed and blocked at the end of row 4 my sample measured 9cm the finished sample weighed around 40g which equates to approximately 80m and was blocked to 25cm square obviously the size weight and meterage of your own squares will be dependent upon your choice of yarn hook and personal gauge abbreviations us terms chain chain st stitch space space magic_ring magic_ring double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet inx in next ieon in each of next brackets indicating a major repeat usually an entire side brackets indicating a minor repeat often into one st or chsp tlsc single_crochet worked into the third loop v v_stitch - 1dc ch1 1dc worked into same st or space note when instructed to work into a v you will be working into the ch1sp popcorn popcorn 4dc worked into same space remove loop from hook insert hook in first double_crochet pick up loop and pull through ch1 pulled tight to close note -this ch1 does not count as a stitch in its own right tldc double_crochet worked into the third loop other stuff to know the first line of instruction relates to the corner group the following line s refer to the next side where express placement instructions are given the skipping of any intervening stitches or spaces is implied i leave it to you to decide how and where to start and how to end each round since there are now so many options out there and you no doubt have your own favourites i personally find it frustrating to have to unpick some else s detailed instructions using their favoured method in order to apply my own the start of this square follows rachele carmona s plain granny square pattern and the sample was constructed using her seamless corner joining method you can find her youtube tutorial here … vibrant vintage 2018 plain granny square pattern r1 3dc ch1 x 4 into magic_ring 3sts per
